Know that some scholars obligated ablution due to laughter during prayer, and some forbade it. I hold the view of forbidding it [i.e., not obligating ablution].

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding It)

When a person is in prayer, his states with Allah vary during his recitation, if he is one of the People of Allah (أهل الله) who contemplate the Quran. One verse may sadden him, so he weeps; another may delight him, so he laughs; another may stun him, so he neither laughs nor weeps; another may grant him knowledge; and another may make him seek forgiveness and supplicate. His purity remains as it was originally.

### [The Human Being Whose States Do Not Vary]

We have seen those whose state is constant laughter, whether in prayer or outside of prayer, such as Al-Salawi and his likes—may Allah benefit us through him—and like Abu Yazid Tayfur ibn Isa ibn Shurushan al-Bistami. Abu Musa al-Daybuli narrated from him that he said, "I laughed for a time and wept for a time, and today I neither laugh nor weep."

### [The One Heedless of His Recitation and Intimate Conversation with His Lord During Prayer]

However, if he is heedless (غفل) of his recitation and contemplation, and of his intimate conversation (مناجاة) with his Lord due to playfulness (لهوه) and similar things that remove him from presence with Allah (الحضور مع الله) in his prayer, then this laughter is considered, in the esoteric sense, a nullification of his purity according to the school of thought that says purity is nullified. Whoever is in this state has had his purity nullified, and it is obligatory upon him to renew the purity of his heart once again.

(Chapter on Ablution from Carrying the Deceased)

### [Nothing Gathers with Anything Except Due to a Correspondence]

A group of scholars held this view, while most scholars forbade it. I hold the view of forbidding it [i.e., not requiring ablution].

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding It)

As for the esoteric ruling (حكم الباطن) regarding this, it relates to the science of correspondence (علم المناسبة). Nothing gathers with anything except due to a correspondence (مناسبة) between them. Abu Hamid al-Ghazali said that one of the People of this Path (أهل هذا الشأن) saw a crow and a dove in the Sanctuary (الحرم) and thought that the correspondence between them was remote, so he was astonished, not knowing the reason for their familiarity with each other. He pointed to them, and they walked away, and behold, both of them were lame (أعرج). Thus, he knew that lameness brought them together.

### [The Story of Shaykh Abu Madyan with Some Merchants]

A merchant used to say to our Shaykh Abu Madyan, "If you see a poor person who needs something, let me know so that it may be done through me." One day, a poor, naked man came to him needing a garment. The Shaykh’s station and state was not to rely on anyone other than Allah in all his affairs, both for himself and for others, for the Shaykhs agreed that whoever’s reliance (توكل) is sound for himself, his reliance is sound for others. Abu Madyan remembered the merchant’s request, so he went out with the poor man to the merchant’s shop to get a garment. A man walked alongside him whom the Shaykh did not recognize. He asked him about his religion, and behold, he was a polytheist (مشرك). The Shaykh recognized the correspondence (المناسبة) and repented to Allah from that thought (الخاطر). He turned around, and the man had left him, and he did not know where he went.

### [Death is Two Kinds: Death from Creation and Death from The Real]

When I was informed of his story, and knowing that in our lands there are no two religions in the lands of Islam at all, I knew that Allah had sent him a person from that thought (خاطره) to alert him. For Allah taught us that He creates beings from the breaths of the knower. Similarly, in this chapter, whoever carries a deceased person, there is a correspondence (مناسبة) between them, which is death (الموت). Death is two kinds: death from contingent beings (موت عن الأكوان) and death from The Real (موت عن الحق). The one who is dead from The Real must perform ablution, while the one who is dead from contingent beings remains in his state of ablution.

(Chapter on the Nullification of Ablution by Loss of Intellect)

Scholars of the Sacred Law (علماء الشريعة) agree that the loss of intellect (زوال العقل) nullifies purity.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding It)

If the intellect (العقل) is removed by a consecutively narrated text (النص المتواتر) of the Sacred Law (الشرع) concerning Divine matters (الإلهيات)—a text that admits neither possibility nor ambiguity—then he is in a state of the most complete purity (أكمل الطهارة), because the purity of faith (طهارة الايمان) combined with the existence of the text grants true knowledge (العلم الحق) and unveiling (الكشف). If his intellect is removed by a specious argument (شبهة), his purity is nullified, and he must renew contemplation (النظر) in another proof or in the removal of that specious argument.

(Chapters on the Acts for Which This Purity is Stipulated)

### [Ablution is a Condition for Prayer]

Scholars agree that ablution (الوضوء) is a condition (شرط) for prayer, but they differed on whether it is a condition of validity (شرط صحة) or a condition of obligation (شرط وجوب). By ablution, I mean the prescribed purification (الطهارة المشروعة). In our view, it is a condition of obligation. Purification (الطهارة), in our view, is an independent act of worship (عبادة مستقلة). It may also be a condition for another act of worship, either a condition of validity or a condition of obligation, or it may be recommended (مستحبة) or a Sunnah in another act of worship.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding That)

The purity of the heart (طهارة القلب) is a condition for intimate conversation with The Real (مناجاة الحق) or witnessing Him (مشاهدته). It is both a condition of obligation (شرط وجوب) and a condition of validity (شرط صحة) simultaneously. The reason for this is that we are in the domain of obligation (موطن التكليف), and faith (الإيمان) is required of us in Allah, in what came from Him, and in the Messenger and the Messengers. This is an indication that the matter is not restricted, but rather lofty and supreme: <<وَفَوْقَ كُلِّ ذِي عِلْمٍ عَلِيمٌ>> (And above every possessor of knowledge is the All-Knowing), <<رَفِيعُ الدَّرَجاتِ>> (Exalter of Ranks), raising the ranks of whomever He wills.

### [Faith is Purity for the Heart from the Veil, and Knowledge is Purity for the Intellect from Ignorance]

Sometimes Knowledge (العلم) is a condition for the validity of faith (الإيمان) and a condition of obligation therein, and sometimes faith is a condition for the validity of the knowledge of unveiling (علم الكشف) and a condition of obligation therein. However, faith is a purity for the heart from the veil (الحجاب), and Knowledge is a purity for the heart from ignorance (الجهل), doubt, and hypocrisy (النفاق). So purify your heart with both purifications, and you will be named thus in the two worlds and acquire the knowledge of the Two Graspings (علم القبضتين). For Allah has obligated faith upon us in Himself, and from Himself are His Names (أسماؤه), and in His angels, His books, and His messengers: <<لا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِنْ رُسُلِهِ>> (We make no distinction between any of His messengers), even though we know that Allah favored some of them over others, both messengers and prophets. Then He forbade us from making distinctions between the prophets based on analogy or contemplation, for the servant does not pass judgment upon Allah concerning anything.

(Chapter on Purification for Funeral Prayers and Prostration of Recitation)

Scholars (أهل العلم) differed concerning purification for the funeral prayer (صلاة الجنائز) and the prostration of recitation (سجود التلاوة). One group says it is a condition (شرط) for them, and another group says it is not a condition. This is the position I hold.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding That)

As for the esoteric ruling (حكم الباطن) regarding all of this, we say that every prescribed act (عمل مشروع) that is not preceded by the purity of faith (طهارة الايمان) is invalid due to its absence. Thus, faith must exist in every prescribed act. Whoever says that ablution is not obligatory for the funeral prayer and the prostration of recitation did not see the necessity of presence (استحضار) for the deceased and the prostration of recitation except in faith during the supplication, and he sufficed with faith in the prayer over the presence required at the commencement of the act. This is the reason for the lack of response (عدم الإجابة). But for the one who considers purity a condition, the response to their supplication is inevitable.

(Chapter on Purification for Touching the Quran)

### [Is Purification a Condition for Touching the Quran?]

Scholars (أهل العلم) differed on whether purification is a condition for touching the Quran (مس المصحف) or not. Some obligated it, and some forbade it. I hold the view of forbidding it [i.e., not obligating it], although performing the act of touching the Quran with purity is better.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding That)

Is the sign (الدليل) respected out of respect for the Signified (المدلول)? In our view, yes, the sign is respected out of respect for the Signified. In the view of others, it is not necessary, for the sign contradicts the Signified, so they do not gather. If the sign is respected, it is for another reason, not because it is a sign of something respected. The Quran (المصحف) is a sign of Allah’s Speech (كلام الله), and we have been commanded to respect it, and touching it while pure is part of respecting it.

### [The World May Be Taken as a Sign of Allah]

Know that we may take the world (العالم) as a sign (دليلا) of Allah, yet be heedless of what the name 'world' encompasses of praiseworthy and blameworthy things. We may take Pharaoh (فرعون) and his like among the arrogant as a sign of the existence of the Maker (الصانع) because he is a creation, and we specifically designated him as a sign. Yet, respecting him is not obligatory; rather, despising him (مقته) and denying him sanctity is obligatory. We may take Moses (موسى عليه السلام), in that he is His creation, as a sign of the existence of the Maker, and we specifically designated him as a sign. Yet, respecting and venerating him is obligatory upon us for another reason, not because he is a sign. For this reason, we venerate the Quran because the Lawgiver commanded us to respect and venerate it, not because it is a sign. Then, it has another sanctity because it is a sign, and by this, we justify respecting it at times, for we say it is the Speech of Allah, even though we are the ones who wrote it with our hands.

(Chapter on the Obligation of Ablution for the Ritually Impure Person When Intending to Sleep, Resume Intercourse, Eat, or Drink)

Scholars of the Sacred Law (علماء الشريعة) differed concerning what we mentioned in this title. One group says it is obligatory (إيجابه), and another says it is recommended (استحبابه). This is the position I hold.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding That)

As for the esoteric ruling (حكم الباطن) regarding this, it is the bringing forth of the intention (النية) for the one whose prescribed purity was nullified by a desire (شهوة) that made him heedless of seeing The Real (رؤية الحق) when its dominion became strong. If he intends to sleep, he intends in his sleep to give the eye its due right; that is the purification of the ritually impure person (الجنب) when he intends to sleep. For ritual impurity (الجنابة) nullified his purity, which is the estrangement (الغربة) from the locus of faith (موطن الايمان) where he should have been present, were it not for the strong dominion of desire that annihilated him from himself and from everything besides Him. Likewise, if he intends to resume intercourse, he intends a believing child (الولد المؤمن) to increase the followers of the Messenger of Allah (صلى الله عليه وسلم) and to increase those who remember Allah through this intercourse. Likewise, if he intends to eat or drink, he intends to give the soul its due right. This intention, in what we have mentioned, is the purification for all of that.

(Chapter on Ablution for Circumambulation)

Know that some people stipulated ablution for circumambulation (الطواف), and some did not stipulate it. This is the position I hold, even though circumambulation with purity is better.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding That)

The one who holds that circumambulation of the House (الطواف بالبيت) is due to its relation to Allah, like the Throne (العرش) related to the establishment of the Most Compassionate, and who sees the angels surrounding it—who are the purified, noble, righteous ones—stipulated ablution for the circumambulation of the Kaaba of his heart (كعبة قلبه), which contained The Real (الحق), majestic is His Glory.

He says, the Exalted: "My earth and My heaven did not contain Me, but the heart of My believing servant contained Me."

This refers to His descent in His Self-disclosure (تجليه) into the heart of His servant, as we explained in *Mawāqi‘ al-Nujūm* in the station of the Essential Descent (التنزل الذاتي) from the sphere of the heart.

### [The Real, Being Absolute and Unconditioned by Anything, Is Not Restricted by Anything He Attributes to Himself]

The one who holds that The Real (الحق), being Absolute and unconditioned by anything (مطلق لا بشرط شي‏ء), is not restricted by anything He attributes to Himself, and that the purpose of such attribution is merely the ennoblement (التشريف) and benefit of the obligated person (المكلف), did not stipulate purification for circumambulation. As for the heart, the absence of stipulating purity occurs when the intellect (العقل) contemplates the establishment of the Sacred Law (الشرع) in the initial gnosis (المعرفة الأولى), either initially or when descending to it by teaching those who wish to know Allah through theoretical proofs (الأدلة النظرية).

(Chapter on Ablution for Reciting the Quran)

Scholars differed concerning ablution for reciting the Quran. One group says that recitation is permissible for one who is not in a state of purity, and this is the position I hold. Another group says that the Quran may not be recited except with ablution, and this is better without dispute. Likewise, everything we mentioned that is permissible to perform without ablution, in our view and the view of others, it is better not to perform any of it except with ablution.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding That)

As for the esoteric ruling (حكم الباطن) regarding this, the reciter of the Quran (قارئ القرآن) is the deputy (نائب) of The Real, exalted is He, in translating His Speech. One of His Attributes is *al-Quddus* (The Holy), meaning the Pure One. Therefore, the servant, when acting as the deputy of The Real in reciting His Speech, should be sanctified (مقدسا), meaning pure outwardly by the prescribed ablution (الوضوء المشروع) and inwardly by faith, presence (الحضور), contemplation (التدبر), and similar states. He should first present the recitation of The Real to himself, and then recite it, translating for The Real what He recited to him and spoke to him.

### [Varieties of Quran Recitation]

He either translates in his recitation for those present to remind them, or he translates with his tongue for himself to hear. Thus, the ear receives its due, just as if the Quran (المصحف) were in his hand, reciting from it, the sight receives its due from looking at the Speech of Allah as it is written, just as the hearing received it from the tongue speaking it and sounding it. Likewise, if he placed the Quran in his lap and ran his hand over the letters, these limbs would take their share of that. This is how our Shaykh Abu Abdullah ibn al-Mujahid, Abu Abdullah ibn Qaysum, and Abu al-Hajjaj al-Sharbili used to recite. I did not see any of our Shaykhs maintain such recitation except these three.

(Chapters on Ritual Bathing: Rulings on the Purity of the Greater Ablution)

### [Generalizing Purification with Water to the Entire Outer Body]

This prescribed ritual bath (الغسل المشروع) in this chapter is the generalization of purification with water to the entire outer body without dispute, and to parts of the body that water can reach even if they are not outwardly visible, such as the inside of the mouth and similar areas, which will be mentioned later. We will mention the causes of this purification, some of which are obligatory (واجب), some Sunnah, and some recommended (مستحب).

### [The Purity of the Soul in the Esoteric Sense]

(The Consideration in That) As for the consideration of this purification, it is the generalization of the purification of the soul (طهارة النفس) from everything it was commanded to be purified from, concerning actions, both outwardly (related to the limbs) and inwardly (related to the soul), specifically from the *expenditures* (مصارف) of its attributes (صفاتها), not from the attributes themselves. We said *expenditures* of its attributes because its attributes are inherent to its original creation and do not separate from it, to the extent that some of our companions considered them to be the very essence of the soul, being psychic attributes (صفات نفسية) such as greed (الحرص), stinginess (البخل), tale-bearing (النميمة), and every blameworthy description.

### [The Object of Blame from Which We Are Commanded to Be Purified]

The object of blame (متعلق الذم) from which we are commanded to be purified is not the attribute itself, but rather the application (المصرف) of the attribute. A person does not purify himself from greed (الحرص); rather, he purifies himself from applying greed to the accumulation of worldly debris and forbidden things. He purifies himself by applying that very greed to seeking knowledge, acquiring means of goodness and righteous deeds, and being greedy for the means of his happiness. For the essence of greed cannot be removed. Greed, in one aspect, brings happiness to the greedy person through that greed, and in another aspect, it brings misery. Therefore, we spoke of the application (المصرف) and not the attribute itself. Based on this, we take all attributes to which blame is attached: the blame is attached to their applications, not to their essences.

### [Rulings on Purity in the Exoteric and Esoteric Senses]

The generalization of inner and outer purity in this ritual bath (الاغتسال) is related only to the applications of the attributes. No one knows the applications of the attributes except one who knows the noble character traits (مكارم الأخلاق), so he purifies himself with them, and knows the base character traits (سفساف الأخلاق), so he purifies himself from them. As for what is hidden among them, which he cannot perceive, he receives it from the Lawgiver (الشارع), which is every action that pleases Allah, so he purifies himself with it from every action that does not please Him, so he purifies himself from it. Allah the Exalted said: <<وَلا يَرْضى‏ لِعِبادِهِ الْكُفْرَ وَإِنْ تَشْكُرُوا يَرْضَهُ لَكُمْ>> (And He does not approve for His servants disbelief; but if you are grateful, He approves it for you). For this reason, we have presented in this book chapters dealing with opposites, such as repentance and its abandonment, piety and its abandonment, and asceticism and its abandonment, whose chapters will come, God willing, and they are numerous.

This purity is also obligatory, like purification by paying Zakat (الزكاة), for example, which is an obligatory ritual bath (غسل واجب). And like giving it to the poor among one's relatives (ذوي الأرحام), which is recommended (مندوب إليه). And like singling out the religious ones among them over other relatives, which is desirable (مستحب). Thus, the ruling of this purity extends throughout the entire inner and outer being of the human, concerning knowledge and ignorance, disbelief and faith, polytheism and monotheism, affirmation and negation. Likewise, in all prescribed actions, he purifies them by conformity (الموافقة) from opposition (المخالفة). This is the meaning of the obligatory and non-obligatory ritual bath. I will present details of the issues of this purification that serve as fundamental principles, according to what is mentioned in the exoteric ruling of the Sacred Law concerning bathing with water. However, the ramifications of this purification are countless and cannot be contained in a book if we were to mention them issue by issue. We have provided the method for acquiring it, so take it according to that model if you wish to be among the servants of Allah whom He chose for His service, fashioned for Himself, and was pleased with, so they were pleased with Him. May Allah make us among the working scholars (العلماء العمال) and not prevent us from being employed in what pleases Him, exalted is He, in deeds, words, actions, and states.

### [The Prescribed Ritual Baths: Agreed Upon and Disputed]

As for the prescribed ritual baths (الاغتسالات المشروعة), some are agreed upon as obligatory, some are disputed as to their obligation, and some are agreed upon as recommended. These are numerous ritual baths, such as bathing from the meeting of the circumcised parts (التقاء الختانين), bathing from the emission of gushing water (الماء الدافق) knowingly, bathing from its emission unknowingly (like finding water without remembering a wet dream), bathing from the emission of gushing water without pleasure, bathing from menstruation (الحيض), bathing for the woman with non-menstrual bleeding (المستحاضة) for prayers, bathing for the day of Friday, bathing for the Friday prayer, bathing upon embracing Islam, bathing for the state of ritual consecration (الإحرام), bathing for entering Mecca, bathing for the standing at Arafat (الوقوف بعرفة), and bathing from washing the deceased. As for the considerations (اعتبارات) in these ritual baths, I will mention them before detailing the fundamental prescribed issues concerning bathing with water and their considerations. Among these is:

(Chapter on Bathing from Washing the Deceased)

Since the washing of the deceased (الميت) is prescribed, and he has no action, as someone else is obligated to wash him, this is an alert to the washer to be before his Lord in his purification, through His granting him success and employing him in His obedience, and in what occurs to him of the acts of his Creator, both by him and in him, just like the deceased before his washer. Thus, he does not see his washing as being due to his washing the deceased; rather, he sees that Allah is the Purifier (المطهر) and sees himself as an instrument (آلة) through which Allah performs that act, just as the washer sees the water as an instrument in achieving the washing of the deceased. For without water, the name "washer" would not be valid for the one who washes him, and the water cannot claim that it washed the deceased, for the water did not move toward him or intend to wash him; rather, the washer intended the washing of the deceased with the water. Likewise, the washer does not see in his intention that he intended to wash the deceased with water; rather, he sees himself and the water as two instruments that Allah intended to use to wash this deceased person. Thus, Allah is the Purifier, not him nor the water. But Allah purified the deceased through the washer and through the water. Such a person does not bathe from washing the deceased. This is the consideration of the one who holds that bathing from washing the deceased is not obligatory.

### [The Consideration of the One Who Holds the Obligation of Bathing from Washing the Deceased]

As for the one who washed a deceased person and was absent during the washing from the realization that Allah is the Purifier, and claimed that act for himself (ادعى ذلك الفعل لنفسه) and attributed it to himself, and believed that without him, this deceased person would not have been purified, it is obligatory upon him to bathe and purify himself from this claim (الدعوى) by turning and being present with Allah (الحضور مع الله) in the future, and by recollecting what he was heedless of concerning Allah’s purification of this deceased person through his hand. Whoever considers this obligated bathing from washing the deceased.

### [The Ruling of Bathing from Washing the Deceased in the Exoteric Ruling of the Sacred Law]

As for the ruling of bathing with water from washing the deceased in the exoteric ruling of the Sacred Law, my school of thought does not hold it to be obligatory. However, if one bathes from it, it is preferable and better without dispute.

(Chapter on Bathing for the Standing at Arafat)

### [The Standing at Arafat in the State of Humility, Need, Supplication, and Entreaty]

Since the Standing at Arafat (الوقوف بعرفة) is in the state of humility (الذل), need (الافتقار), supplication (الدعاء), and entreaty (الابتهال), by stripping off sewn garments (لباس المخيط), and the place where the pilgrim stands is called Arafat, we understood the consideration that this is the station of the scholars knowing Allah (العلماء العارفين بالله). For Allah says: <<إِنَّما يَخْشَى اللهَ مِنْ عِبادِهِ الْعُلَماءُ>> (Only those who have knowledge among His servants fear Allah), and He said: <<تَرى‏ أَعْيُنَهُمْ تَفِيضُ مِنَ الدَّمْعِ مِمَّا عَرَفُوا مِنَ الْحَقِّ>> (You see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognized of the truth). The discussion on this type will come, God willing, in the chapter on Hajj in this book.

### [The Gnosis of Allah Through Intellectual Contemplation and Through Divine Gift]

When this contemplating scholar (المعتبر العالم) saw his stripping off of sewn garments (المخيط), he considered it a rejection of the composition and arrangement of proofs (الأدلة) for attaining the Gnosis of Allah (المعرفة بالله) through intellectual contemplation (النظر الفكري)—by arranging premises and composing them, from which the form of gnosis of his Lord appears, like the tailor who joins pieces of a shirt together to reveal the form of the shirt. He was told, by stripping off the sewn garment, to attain gnosis of his Lord or Knowledge of Allah (العلم بالله) through Divine or Lordly Self-disclosure (التجلي الإلهي أو الرباني). And to cast aside in this station and on this day intellectual contemplation (النظر العقلي) through the arrangement of premises, and to busy himself today with attaining gnosis of his Lord through Divine favor (الامتنان الإلهي) and the Lordly Gift (الوهب الرباني) from The Giver (الواهب), who gives to bestow grace. For He is the One who casts knowledge of Himself into your soul in every state, whether you contemplate the arrangement of premises or not. So deal with Him, exalted is He, through stripping away (التجريد), for that is more appropriate for you. Do not turn to your arrangement of theoretical premises in the Knowledge of Allah, for that is darkness in gnosis, seen only by the insightful, as there is no correspondence between what you arrange of that and what His Essence, majestic and exalted, deserves.

### [The Purification of the Heart from Reliance on Other Than the Lord in the Gnosis of the Lord]

How can one who is required to be in this state in that noble station and momentous, great scene not bathe and purify himself inwardly and his heart from reliance on anything other than the Lord in his gnosis of his Lord? He removes from himself the filth and grime of witnessing others (الأغيار) by knowing The Real through The Real (علم الحق بالحق), not by knowing Him through himself. For there is no sign (دليل) of Him except Him. Gnosis (المعرفة) relates to a single object, and you are in Arafat. Knowledge (العلم) relates to two objects. For this reason, the possessor of this station, upon leaving Arafat for Muzdalifah (المزدلفة), which is Gathering (جمع), attains another knowledge whose object of knowledge is Allah, just as his object of knowledge in Arafat was the Lord, exalted is He. This single object attained by you on this day is your knowledge of your Lord, not of yourself. Thus, you know The Real by The Real, and The Real, by which you bathed, grants that gnosis of Himself. The thing from which you bathed (المغتسل منه) is the object of the passive participle, namely your own soul in its claim to know its Lord through itself by means of contrived effort in attaining it. Where is the sign from the Sign? Far be it! By His might, you do not know Him, if you know Him, except through Him. So understand! This is your bathing for the Standing at Arafat, if you are granted success in it. And Allah is the Supporter and the Inspirer.

(Chapter on Bathing for Entering Mecca, May Allah Increase Its Honor)

Know that entering Mecca is arriving at Allah in His Presence (حضرته). Therefore, it is necessary to renew the purity of your heart from the heedlessness (غفلات) it acquired since the time of your ritual consecration (إحرام), outwardly with water and inwardly with knowledge and presence (الحضور). The outward purity is bathing with water as an act of worship and cleansing. The inward purity, which is the heart’s purity, is achieved by disavowal (التبري) seeking allegiance (الولاء), for there is no allegiance to The Real except by disavowing creation (الخلق) when your gaze was directed toward them by yourself, not by Allah.

### [Permanent Presence with Allah and Bathing for Entering Mecca]

Whoever’s state is permanent presence with Allah (الحضور الدائم مع الله) only performs the outward ritual bath with water for entering Mecca to establish the Sunnah. As for the inner state, he does not need it, except upon seeing the House (البيت), for he purifies himself inwardly with a specific shyness (حياء خاص) at the sight of His special House, and the circumambulators (الطائفون) around it, who are like those surrounding <<حَوْلِ الْعَرْشِ يُسَبِّحُونَ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّهِمْ>> (the Throne, glorifying with the praise of their Lord). This is because the House of Allah has been without intermediary since Allah created the world; no hand of a creature has touched it through acquisition.

### [The Divine Name by Which the Circumambulator Around the Kaaba Purifies Himself]

Let the Divine Name (الاسم الإلهي) by which the circumambulator around the Kaaba purifies himself be the Name *Al-Awwal* (The First) among the Beautiful Names, for it is one of the descriptions of the House, thus achieving correspondence. Allah the Exalted said: <<إِنَّ أَوَّلَ بَيْتٍ وُضِعَ لِلنَّاسِ لَلَّذِي بِبَكَّةَ مُبارَكاً>> (Indeed, the first House established for mankind was that at Bakkah, blessed), meaning, "I placed blessing (البركة) in it for My servants, and guidance (الهدى)." Whoever sees the House and does not find an increase (زيادة) from Allah within himself has not attained anything of the blessing of the House, because *barakah* means increase. If he does not find what The Real added to him, it indicates that his intention was not sound, for hastening food for a guest is a Sunnah.

### [Blessing and Guidance in the Sacred House of Allah]

Let his bathing be primary, not secondary to the bathing for *ihram* that preceded it, for it is a specific purification suitable for witnessing the House and circumambulating it, having no correspondence with the bathing for *ihram* except in one aspect. If he claims that he purified himself with this purification and finished his circumambulation, he should inspect his inner self. For Allah did not place blessing (البركة) and guidance (الهدى)—meaning clarification—in it unless that which his Lord increased him in knowledge of Him became clear to him. The blessing was placed in the House only so that its custodian might grant the circumambulator who arrives at it robes of blessing, nearness, care, and clarification (البيان), which is guidance, concerning difficult matters of states and obscure Divine issues in the Knowledge of Allah, befitting that chosen House, the locus of the Right Hand of The Real, the one sworn allegiance to, the one faced in prayer.

### [The House of Allah is the Treasury of His Treasures on Earth]

This House is Allah’s treasury (خزانة) of blessings and guidance. The Lawgiver alerted us by allusion to the treasure (الكنز) within it. What treasure is greater than what Allah mentioned: blessing and guidance, since He made them the very essence of the House? Its treasure belongs to the One to whom it is attributed, which is Allah.

### [The Fruits of Circumambulation in the Heart of the Circumambulator in the Holiest Circuit]

Let the arriving circumambulator look into his heart when he finishes his circumambulation. If he finds an increase in the gnosis of his Lord and a clarification in his knowledge that he did not possess before, then he knows the soundness of his bathing for entering Mecca. If he finds nothing of that, he knows that he did not purify himself and did not arrive at his Lord, nor did he circumambulate His House. For it is impossible for anyone to descend upon a Generous, Rich One and enter His House without being hosted. If he finds no increase, he has done no more than his bathing with water and arriving at built stones. He is a person of toil and disappointment in his heart, and he has nothing but the reward for outward deeds in the Hereafter in the Gardens, which is what the generality of believers attain. If he stays, he stays near the stones, not the Essence. If he returns to his country, he returns with the sandals of Hunayn (خفي حنين) [i.e., empty-handed]. May Allah make us among the People of Hearts (أهل القلوب), the People of Allah, and His chosen ones, Amen, by His might. If the afflicted person admits the lack of increase and what he was deprived of, he will have the reward of the afflicted in the Hereafter, but he will be deprived of gnosis in this world.

(Chapter on Bathing for Ritual Consecration (*Ihram*))

### [Purification of the Limbs and Purification of the Inner Being]

Its consideration is the purification of the limbs (الجوارح) from what is forbidden for the person in *ihram* to do, and the purification of the inner being (الباطن) from everything he left behind. Just as he left behind family, wealth, and children physically, and arrived at the House of Allah with his outward being, he should not turn his heart except toward what he is facing, and he should prevent anything he left behind from entering his heart or occurring to him, through repentance (التوبة) and return to Allah (الرجوع إلى الله). For this reason, it is called the bath of *ihram* (ritual consecration), due to what is forbidden to him outwardly and inwardly. If this is not his state, he is not in *ihram* inwardly.

### [If the Gatekeeper Sleeps, the Guardian of the Gate Remains]

For the gatekeeper may have slept and become heedless, and the gate remained without a guardian. Thus, the suggestions of the souls (خواطر النفوس) and the suggestions of the devils found no one to prevent them from entering his heart. He says *Labbayk* (Here I am) with his tongue, imagining that he is answering the call of his Lord to approach Him, while he is answering the call of the suggestion of his soul or his devil, who calls him in his heart, "O so-and-so!" He replies, "Here I am!" The suggestion then tells him, according to what its sender—whether soul or devil—sent it with, and what it brought him other than what was prescribed for him of turning toward Him in that state, the owner of that suggestion says to him upon his saying *Labbayk*: "Welcome! You have answered the call of one who grants you deprivation, disappointment, and manifest loss," and rejoices that he has made him a god and answered his call. Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah through the tongue of the inner being and the state, and the preceding intention, <<لَمَسَّكُمْ فِيما أَفَضْتُمْ فِيهِ>> (there would have touched you concerning that in which you indulged)—of your hearts turning to what you left behind physically—<<عَذابٌ عَظِيمٌ>> (a great punishment). So Allah forgives them what they spoke to themselves and what Satan suggested to them in that state, through the care of the outward *Labbayk* alone, but He does not grant their hearts what He grants to the People of the Inner Bath (أهل الاغتسال الباطن) among those in *ihram*.

(Chapter on Bathing Upon Embracing Islam: It is a Sunnah, Rather an Obligation)

Bathing upon embracing Islam is prescribed, and the Prophetic narration has confirmed it. As for its consideration in the esoteric sense, Islam is submission (الانقياد). If a person manifests outward submission, he is outwardly Muslim. It is then obligatory upon him to submit inwardly so that he is inwardly Muslim as he was outwardly. Thus, here it is the purification of the inner being upon embracing Islam with faith (الإيمان). Allah the Exalted said concerning a group who said, "We have believed": <<قُلْ لَمْ تُؤْمِنُوا وَلَكِنْ قُولُوا أَسْلَمْنا وَلَمَّا يَدْخُلِ الْإِيمانُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ>> (Say, "You have not believed; but say, 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts"). This faith is the beneficial inner purity (الطهارة الباطنة النافعة) that saves one from eternal dwelling in the Fire.

(Chapter on Bathing for the Friday Prayer)

Its consideration in the esoteric sense is the purity of the heart for meeting his Lord (اجتماعه بربه) and concentrating his resolve upon Him for intimate conversation (مناجاته) by lifting the veil (رفع الحجاب) from his heart. For this reason, those who hold that the Friday prayer is valid and established with two people—which is the position I hold—say:

Allah the Exalted said: "I have divided the prayer between Myself and My servant into two halves," (the Hadith). And He mentioned a third part where the servant says such-and-such, and He says to him, "Such-and-such." Therefore, the one who seeks this state must purify himself with a specific purification for it, for it is a station of connection (وصلة). For this reason, the Friday prayer was prescribed as two cycles (*rak‘āt*). The first is from the servant to Allah in what he says, and the second is from Allah to the servant in what He informs him in response to his saying, or what He informs the Highest Assembly (الملأ الأعلى) according to what the servant utters in his prayer. However, in the Friday prayer, according to what is prescribed for him, he must recite aloud. So Allah says to the Highest Assembly, "My servant has praised Me," or whatever he said of response, praise, entrustment, and glorification.

(Chapter on Bathing for the Day of Friday)

### [Purification for the Friday Prayer is the Purity of the State, and for the Day is the Purity of the Time]

The consideration is purification by the Eternal (الأزل) for the daily time of the seven days, which are the days of Friday. For Allah has prescribed a right obligatory upon every servant to bathe every seven days. The bath of Friday is for the day, not for the prayer. Thus, the purification for the Friday prayer was the purity of the state (طهارة الحال), and this is the purity of the time (طهارة الزمان).

### [Is the Friday Bath for the Day or for the Prayer?]

Scholars differed: one group says the bath is for the day of Friday, and this is our school of thought. If one performs it before the Friday prayer and also intends the bath for the Friday prayer, it is better. Another group says it is for the Friday prayer on the day of Friday, and this is better without dispute, such that if one omits it before the prayer, it remains obligatory upon him to bathe until sunset.

### [The Day of Friday is the Day of the Servant’s Gathering upon The Real]

Since we said that the servant’s gathering upon The Real (الحق) occurs on this temporal day, the relation of this day to the presence of The Real is what the Eternal (الأزل) enters into of temporal determinations (التقديرات الزمانية) by specifying the orientations of The Real for the existence of contingent beings in different times, accompanied by before, after, and now: <<لِلَّهِ الْأَمْرُ مِنْ قَبْلُ وَمِنْ بَعْدُ>> (To Allah belongs the command before and after). So know this, for it is extremely subtle.

### [Bathing for the Friday Prayer is the Combination of the Purity of State and Time]

Whoever bathes for the Friday prayer has combined the bath for the state and the time. Whoever bathes for the day of Friday after the prayer has isolated it, which is a flaw in the meaning of *Jumu‘ah* (Gathering). The most apparent view is that it is prescribed for the day of Friday and for the Friday prayer, and this is the most appropriate. It is not unlikely that this was the intention of the Lawgiver.

(Chapter on the Bath of the Woman with Non-Menstrual Bleeding, Which Will Be Mentioned, and We Will Explain Our School of Thought Regarding It)

As for its consideration, *istihada* (الاستحاضة) is a sickness (مرض). The servant is commanded to validate his worship so that no sickness enters it. Whenever he is afflicted in any of his acts of worship, he purifies himself from that ailment and removes it, so that he may worship Allah as a pure, unadulterated servant (عبدا خالصا محضا), untainted by ailment or sickness in his worship or servitude.

(Chapter on Bathing from Menstruation)

### [Menstruation is a Kick of Satan, So Bathing from It is Obligatory]

Menstruation (الحيض) is a kick of Satan (ركضة شيطان), so bathing from it is obligatory. Allah the Exalted said that it is <<رِجْسٌ مِنْ عَمَلِ الشَّيْطانِ>> (an abomination of Satan’s handiwork). Therefore, the heart must be purified from the suggestion of Satan (لمة الشيطان) when it descends upon it and touches it inwardly, and purified by the suggestion of the Angel (لمة الملك). The white discharge (القصة البيضاء) is the sign, or one of the signs, of Allah’s care for this heart, as He drove away and removed the kick of Satan from it. Thus, the suggestion of the Angel is employed at that time, which is the purification of the heart, even if it is metaphorically referred to by the two fingers, both of which are mercy, for He attributed them to *al-Rahman* (The Most Compassionate). Were it not for Allah’s mercy upon His servant through that Satanic suggestion, he would not have attained the reward for opposing it by changing it and turning away from it to act upon the suggestion of the Angel. Thus, he has two rewards. For this reason, we said He attributed them to the Name *al-Rahman*.

### [Regret is the Main Pillar of Repentance]

If Satan leads him astray, he struggles against his soul (جاهد نفسه) not to do what Satan inclined him toward. He is rewarded the reward of the striver (المجاهد). If he acts and repents after struggling, the pre-existing decree (القدر السابق) assists Satan in the action, so the action occurs from him, and he sees that this is from Satan, believing and affirming this, just as Moses (عليه السلام) said: <<هذا مِنْ عَمَلِ الشَّيْطانِ إِنَّهُ عَدُوٌّ مُضِلٌّ مُبِينٌ>> (This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest enemy who misleads). And he repented immediately after the action occurred. By repentance (التوبة) here, I mean regret (الندم), for it is the main pillar of repentance, and it has been narrated that regret is repentance. He receives the reward of a martyr (شهيد) for the occurrence of the action from him, and the martyr is alive, not dead.

### [And What Life is Greater or More Complete Than the Life of Hearts with Allah?]

And what life is greater or more complete than the life of hearts with Allah (حياة القلوب مع الله) in any action? For presence (الحضور) with faith when the transgression occurs keeps that action alive with the life of presence, seeking forgiveness for him until the Day of Resurrection. This is part of the care of the Name *al-Rahman* (The Most Compassionate), to whom the two fingers were attributed. Satan strives to weaken the good for the servant, and the servant is unaware, for greed blinds him, and the evil consequence and sin of that transgression revert to Satan. This is part of Allah’s subtle planning (*makr*) against Iblis.

### [An Aspect of Allah’s Subtle Planning Against Iblis]

If Iblis knew that Allah would grant the servant special happiness through that suggestion from Satan, he would not have cast anything of it toward him. This Divine subtle planning (المكر الإلهي) against Iblis is something I have not seen anyone alert to. Were it not for my knowledge of Iblis and my awareness of his ignorance and his eagerness to incite transgression, I would not have alerted to this, knowing that were it not for this impediment, he would avoid the suggestion of transgression. This is what compelled me to mention it, because Satan does not stop at it, being veiled by his eagerness for the servant’s misery and his ignorance that Allah accepts the repentance of this specific servant. For every one against whom the subtle plan is made (الممكور به), Allah plans against him from where he does not perceive, though others against whom the subtle plan is not made may perceive it.

(Chapter on Bathing from Semen Emitted Without Pleasure)

Scholars differed concerning this. One group says it is obligatory, and another group says bathing is not obligatory upon him. This is the position I hold.

(Section on the Esoteric Ruling Regarding It)

The consideration of ritual impurity (الجنابة) is estrangement (الغربة). Estrangement only occurs by leaving one's homeland, and the homeland of the human is his servitude (عبوديته). If he leaves his homeland and enters the bounds of Lordship (الربوبية), thus being described by an attribute of sovereignty (السيادة) over the people of his homeland and his peers, yet finds no pleasure in that, he has not fulfilled the right of the attribute of sovereignty. For the pleasure of the perfect one (الكامل) in his perfection is incomparable to any other pleasure, and the joy of perfection is unlike any other joy. Since he did not fulfill the right of the attribute, bathing became incumbent upon him, which is the acknowledgment of his shortcoming regarding the right of that Divine attribute. From this perspective, those who obligated bathing upon one who emitted semen while awake without pleasure did so. As for the one who holds that the attribute of perfection, which is appropriate for the Necessary Existent by Himself, has no ruling upon the servant when he is described by it in his estrangement because he is not its proper locus, he did not obligate bathing upon him.

(Chapter on Bathing from Water Found by the Sleeper Upon Waking, Without Remembering a Wet Dream)

In such a case, the ruling of the Prophet’s saying remains: <<إِنَّما الْماءُ مِنَ الْماءِ>> (Water is only from water). This specifies what is abrogated, as some see it.

(Section on its Esoteric Consideration)

The Gnostic (العارف) finds contraction (*qabd*) or expansion (*bast*) in one of his states without knowing its cause—a matter that is dangerous among the People of the Path (أهل الطريق). He knows that this is due to his heedlessness (غفلة) in monitoring his heart regarding its incoming inspirations (وارداته) and the lack of penetration of his insight into the correspondence (مناسبة) between his state and the matter that caused him that attribute. Thus, submission to the incoming decrees (موارد القضاء) becomes incumbent upon him until he sees what that produces for him in the future.

### [Complete Presence with The Real in the Science of Correspondences]

If he knows Him, it is incumbent upon him to perform the ritual bath [الاغتسال] through complete Presence [الحضور التام] with The Real [الحق] in the science of correspondences [علم المناسبات], so that he does not remain ignorant of the sanctifying inspirations [واردات التقديس] that descend upon him from The Real, and what Name [الاسم] brought that to him, and what Name was brought forth from his own side, and what Divine Name [الاسم الإلهي] is currently ruling over him, which is the one that summoned that inspiration. These are three: the summoning Name [الاسم المستدعي], the Name summoned from [الاسم المستدعى منه], and the Name by which the inspiration arrived [الاسم الوارد به]. For The Real, in terms of His Essence [الذات], there is no way for a correspondence [مناسبة] to link us to Him or Him to us: <<لَيْسَ كَمِثْلِهِ شَيْءٌ وهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْبَصِيرُ>> (There is nothing whatever like unto Him, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing). Thus, it is through His Names [الأسماء] that we attach ourselves, through them that we acquire character [نتخلق], and through them that we realize our reality [نتحقق]. And Allah is the Granter of success.

(Chapter on the ritual bath [ghusl] from the meeting of the two circumcised parts without emission)

The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When the circumcised part meets the circumcised part, the ritual bath becomes obligatory."

Scholars differed on this matter. Some said that the ritual bath is obligatory from the meeting of the two circumcised parts, and others said that the ritual bath is not obligatory from the meeting of the two circumcised parts, and this is the view I hold.

(Connection) The consideration [الاعتبار] in this is:

When the servant [العبد] exceeds his limit and enters the bounds of Lordship [الربوبية], and includes his Lord within that limit by describing Him with attributes belonging to contingent beings [الممكنات], then purification [الطهر] from that is incumbent upon him. For the transcendence [تنزيه] of the servant lies in his not departing from his contingency [إمكانه], nor including the Necessary Being [الواجب لنفسه] within his contingency. Thus, he should not say, "It is possible [يجوز] for Allah to do such-and-such," or "It is possible for Him not to do it," for that requires a determining factor [المرجح], whereas The Real [الحق] possesses absolute necessity [الوجوب على الإطلاق]. What should be said is that it is possible for movement to occur from the mover, and it is possible for it not to occur, thus requiring a determining factor. If the knower of Allah Almighty is in this state, the ritual bath [الاغتسال] becomes incumbent upon him, which is purification from this knowledge by means of the knowledge that does not place Him under the category of possibility [الجواز]. This matter will be revisited, God willing.

(Chapter on the ritual bath from major ritual impurity [الجنابة] due to pleasure)

[Major ritual impurity (الجنابة) is the servant’s estrangement from his homeland]

We have established that major ritual impurity [الجنابة] is estrangement [الغربة], and here it is the servant’s estrangement from his rightful homeland, which is none other than servitude [العبودية]. Or it is the estrangement of a Lordly Attribute [صفة ربانية] from its proper place, such that the servant describes himself with it, or describes a contingent being [ممكنا] with it. In this case, purification [الطهر] is obligatory without dispute.

[The one hundred and fifty states for each of which the ritual bath is obligatory]

Know that this single ritual bath mentioned in this chapter branches out into one hundred and fifty states, from each of which the servant must perform the ritual bath in his heart. We shall mention all their specific instances [أعيانها], God Almighty willing, in ten sections, each section containing fifteen states, so that you may know how to receive them when they descend upon the servant’s heart, for they must necessarily descend upon every heart, whether of the common people [العوام] or the elite [الخصوص]. And Allah is the Supporter and the Inspirer; there is no power except through Him. These are:

(The First Section)
Omnipotence [الجبروت], Divinity [الألوهية], Might [العزة], Dominion [المهيمنية], Faith [الايمان], Sustaining [القيام], Longing [الشوق], Loyalty [الولاء], Darkness [الظلمة], Magic [السحر], General Mercy [عموم الرحمة], Specific Mercy [خصوصها], Safety [السلامة], Purity [الطهارة], and Sovereignty [الملك].

(The Second Section)
Grandeur [الكبرياء], Concealment [الستر], Form [الصورة], Character/Creation [الخلق], Exoneration [البراءة], Sincerity [الإخلاص], Affirmation [الإقرار], Piety [البر], Sincere Advice [النصيحة], Love [الحب], Domination [القهر], Gift [الهبة], Sustenance [الرزق], Openings [الفتوح], and Knowledge [العلم].

(The Third Section)
Expansion [البسط], Contraction [القبض], Honoring [الإعزاز], Raising of Degrees [رفع الدرج], Lowering of the Scale [خفض الميزان], Association [الشرك], Equity [الإنصاف], Obedience [الطاعة], Contentment [الرضي], Acceptance [القناعة], Humiliation [الإذلال], Sounds [الأصوات], Vision [الرؤية], Divine Decree [القضاء], and Justice [العدالة].

(The Fourth Section)
Subtlety [اللطف], Trial [الاختبار], Lifting of Veils [رفع الستور], Magnificence [العظمة], Forbearance [الحلم], Gratitude [الشكر], Ascendancy [الاعتلاء], Preservation [المحافظة], Predetermination [التقدير], Increase [الزيادة], Limits [الحدود], Caprice [الهوى], Contention [المنازعة], Sainthood [الولاية], and Granting Ownership [التمليك].

(The Fifth Section)
Womb/Kinship [الرحم], Bringing Joy [إدخال السرور], Severance [القطيعة], Deception [الخداع], Gradual Enticement [الاستدراج], Reckoning [الحسبان], Majesty [الجلالة], Generosity [الكرم], Vigilance [المراقبة], Response [الإجابة], Amplitude [الاتساع], Wisdom [الحكمة], Affection [الوداد], Resurrection [البعث], and Honor [الشرف].

(The Sixth Section)
Witnessing [الشهادة], The Real Sworn By [الحق المحلوف به], Trusteeship [الوكالة], Strength [القوة], Firmness in everything [الصلابة في كل شي‏ء], Support [النصرة], Praise [الثناء], Enumeration [الإحصاء], Initiation [الابتداء], Restoration [الإعادة], Charity [الصدقة], Speech [القول], Pardon [العفو], Command [الأمر], and Prohibition [النهي].

(The Seventh Section)
Character [الأخلاق], Wealth [المال], Status [الجاه], Increase [الزيادة], Faith [الايمان], Life [الحياة], Death [الموت], Giving Life [الأحياء], Self-Subsistence [القيومية], Finding/Ecstasy [الوجدان], Anticipation [الاستشراف], Unity [الوحدة], Eternally Besought [الصمداني], Power [القدرة], and Omnipotence [الاقتدار].

(The Eighth Section)
Precedence [التقديم], Delay [التأخير], The First Abode [الدار الأولى], The Hereafter [الآخرة], Concealment [الاختفاء], Lifting of Veils [إشالة الحجب], Excellence [الإحسان], Return [الرجوع], Retribution [الانتقام], Forgiveness [الصفح], Interdiction [الحجر], Marriage [النكاح], Ostentation [الرياء], Fabrication [الاختلاق], and Slander [البهت].

(The Ninth Section)
Compassion [الرأفة], Sovereignty of the Kingdom [ملك الملك], Miraculous Gifts [الكرامات], Appointed Times [الآجال], Exaltation [التعالي], Sophistry [المغالطة], Gathering/Synthesis [الجمع], Self-Sufficiency [الاستغناء], Transgression [التعدي], Sufficiency [الكفاية], Generosity [السخاء], Lying [الكذب], Denial [التكذيب], Governance [السياسة], and Divine Laws [النواميس].

(The Tenth Section)
Withholding [المنع], Guidance [الهداية], Benefit [الانتفاع], Harm [الضرر], Light [النور], Origination [الابتداع], Subsistence [البقاء], Inheritance [التوارث], Right Guidance [الرشد], Intimacy [الإيناس], Harm/Injury [الأذى], Bestowal of Favor [الامتنان], Zeal [الحماسة], Resistance [المقاومة], and Spy [الجاسوس].

[The one who purifies himself from every state requires extensive knowledge]

Know—may Allah support us and you with a spirit from Him—that everything we have mentioned in these sections, and what each state implies that we have not mentioned for fear of prolixity, requires the purification of the human being's inner self [باطنه] and heart from it, according to the school of the People of Allah [أهل الله] and their elite among the People of Unveiling [أهل الكشف], without dispute among the People of Spiritual Tastes [أهل الأذواق] concerning this. However, the one who purifies himself from most of these states requires extensive knowledge [علم غزير] regarding the manner of purification from what we have mentioned, and sometimes one state may be the purification for another. Then we return to our purpose of presenting the prescribed rulings concerning this purification, which is the ritual bath [الاغتسال] with water, and its considerations and rulings in the inner self [الباطن]. I say: We have already mentioned in the chapter on ablution [الوضوء] upon whom purification is obligatory and when it becomes obligatory, so we do not need to mention what is common to both purifications.

(Chapter on rubbing the entire body with the hand during the ritual bath)

Scholars of the Sacred Law [الشريعة] differed regarding rubbing the entire body with the hand. Some said that it is a condition for the completeness of purification, and others said it is not a condition. As for our school, it is sufficient to convey the water to the body until it covers it completely, by whatever means possible.

(Connection) The ruling concerning this in the inner self [الباطن] is:

Thoroughness [الاستقصاء] in the purification of the inner self, due to the hiddenness [الخفاء] that souls conceal, such as the love of praise from people for the good that emanates from them. By whatever means this attribute, and every impediment that prevents the universality of inner purification, can be removed, then purification is achieved.

(Chapter on intention [النية] in the ritual bath)

Scholars differed regarding the condition of intention [النية] in the ritual bath. Some scholars stipulated it, and this is the view I hold, while others did not stipulate it.

(Connection) Its consideration in the inner self [الباطن] is:

It is necessary to stipulate it in the purification of the inner self, for it is the spirit and life of the action. Intention [النية] is an action of the inner self, so it is indispensable. We have already discussed it at the beginning of the chapter, both outwardly and inwardly.

(Chapter on rinsing the mouth [المضمضة] and nose [الاستنشاق] in the ritual bath)

Scholars of the Sacred Law differed regarding rinsing the mouth and nose in the ritual bath. Some said they are obligatory, and others said they are not obligatory. What we hold is that since the ritual bath includes ablution [الوضوء], the ruling concerning them applies insofar as the person is performing ablution within his bath, not insofar as he is performing the bath itself. For it was not reported that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, rinsed his mouth or nose in his bath except during the ablution performed within it. I have not seen anyone draw attention to this point in their disagreement. Thus, the ruling concerning them, in my view, reverts to the ruling of ablution. And ablution is indispensable in our view for the ritual bath from major ritual impurity [الجنابة]. We have a consideration regarding two cases in this matter: The first case is for one who has intercourse but does not emit semen; he must perform two ablutions during his bath. If he has intercourse and emits semen, he performs one ablution. However, our school holds that the meeting of the two circumcised parts without emission does not necessitate the ritual bath but necessitates ablution. This was the view of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri and other Companions, and Al-A'mash. The discussion on the condition of sequence [الترتيب] and immediacy [الفور] in ablution and its consideration has already preceded.

(Chapter on the nullifiers of this purification, which is the ritual bath)

Its nullifiers are major ritual impurity [الجنابة], menstruation [الحيض], irregular bleeding [الاستحاضة], and the meeting of the two circumcised parts. Menstruation is a nullifier without dispute, as is the emission of fluid due to pleasure while awake, without dispute. What is other than these two is disputed, for some early scholars did not consider the ritual bath obligatory for a woman who finds fluid from a wet dream, even if pleasure was present.

(Chapter on the obligation of purification from intercourse)

Some said it is obligatory whether emission occurs or not, if the two circumcised parts meet. Others said it is obligatory with the emission of fluid, and this is the view I hold, as well as with the emission of fluid without intercourse. A group of the People of the Literal [أهل الظاهر] held that purification is obligatory only from emission.

(Connection) Its consideration in the inner self [الباطن] is:

Intercourse [الوطء] is the turning of the influencing agent [المؤثر] toward the influenced subject [المؤثر فيه] through a form of bestowal [الوهب]. The influenced subject is either present and aware of the specificity of that influencing agent among the Divine Names [الأسماء الإلهية], in which case purification is not obligatory upon him, or he is not, in which case purification is obligatory. That influencing agent may sometimes cause the heart to sleep. Furthermore, this Divine Name either influences the knowledge of a specific cosmic entity [كون من الأكوان] or knowledge related to Allah. In both cases, if he sees himself as the one having intercourse (the agent) and does not take hold of Allah—like charity falling into the Hand of the All-Merciful, even if the beggar takes it and Allah is the Giver—then the Glorified One is the Giver and the Taker, and thus there is no purification required for him in the inner self.

[By The Real is the purification of things]

For by The Real [الحق] is the purification of things. If he is absent from this Witnessing [الشهود] and sees himself as the one taking the knowledge that Allah has sent down upon his heart, purification from seeing himself is incumbent upon him. Likewise, if he "has intercourse" with another by teaching him a matter, either through state [الحال] or speech [القول]. If this is done out of Presence [حضور], there is no purification upon him, for he remains in his state of purity. But if he sees himself in his teaching of others, whether by state or speech, purification from seeing himself is incumbent upon him; this is necessary. For the Men of Allah [رجال الله] in this Path move by Allah and rest by Him, based on direct Vision [مشاهدة] and Unveiling [كشف]. Their common folk rely on the presence of conviction and faith in what has been revealed: that the command is in His Hand, and that the forelocks of His servants and every creature are in His Hand.

(Chapter on the attribute considered for semen emission necessitating the ritual bath)

Scholars differed regarding the attribute considered for semen emission necessitating the ritual bath. Some considered pleasure [اللذة], and others considered the emission itself, whether accompanied by pleasure or not.

(Connection) The consideration in this chapter is:

The pleasure experienced by the enjoyer is either psychic [نفسية] or Divine [إلهية]. If it is natural psychic pleasure, the ritual bath is obligatory. If it is not psychic, that knowledge, which is in the position of major ritual impurity [الجنابة], either relates to Allah or relates to a cosmic entity [كون من الأكوان]. If it relates to Allah and the pleasure is not psychic, there is no purification upon him. If it relates to cosmic entities, purification is upon him, whether he experienced pleasure or not. By our saying "Divine pleasure," I mean the pleasure of perfection [لذة الكمال], not the pleasure of the inspiration [لذة الوارد]. The pleasure of perfection for the servant is that he be a pure servant, not characterized by estrangement [الغربة] from his homeland in his inner self. Even if The Real bestows upon him whatever He wills of the attributes of Lordship [صفات السيادة] from His Presence [حضرة], that does not remove him from his homeland. If this is the case, he is not subject to major ritual impurity, as he has no estrangement; he has never left his homeland, and this is the ultimate perfection. Purification is the recognition of deficiency.

(Chapter on the person in a state of major ritual impurity [جنب] entering the mosque)

Some said it is absolutely forbidden, others said it is forbidden except for one passing through who is not staying, and others said it is permissible for everyone, and this is the view I hold.

(Connection) The consideration in this is:

The Gnostic [العارف], by virtue of being a Gnostic, never departs from being with Allah always. In the Hadith: "The entire earth has been made a mosque for me." The person in a state of major ritual impurity [جنب] cannot cease to be on the earth, and if he is on the earth, he is in the general prescribed mosque, which is not restricted by the conditions of the mosques known by custom.

[The entire world is always passing with the breaths]

Furthermore, the Gnostic—indeed, the entire world, its high and low parts—cannot correctly be described as being in a state of permanence [الإقامة]. It is always passing [عابر] with the breaths [الأنفاس]. The knowers of Allah witness this passing, while those who do not know Allah imagine that they are permanent residents. Existence [الوجود] is contrary to that. For the Creating God [الإله الموجد] is a Creator acting in every breath, so He does not leave a single breath idle, characterized by permanence. As He said: <<كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ في شَأْنٍ>> (Every day He is engaged in some affair). And He Almighty said: <<سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ الثَّقَلانِ>> (We shall attend to you, O you two heavy ones [jinn and mankind]). And He said: "In His Hand is the Scale, He lowers and raises."

[The one who acquires character, whenever he annihilates himself from that acquisition, is not characterized]

Whoever said that it is forbidden was overcome by the vision of himself [رؤية نفسه] as not being a pure place, since he has not acquired the character of the Divine Names [الأسماء الإلهية]. Even if he acquired that character but did not annihilate himself [يفن] from his acquisition in his own view, he has not truly acquired it. In our view, the one who acquires the character of the Names, whenever he annihilates himself from his acquisition of them, is not characterized by them. For the meaning of being characterized by them is that they subsist in him, just as the acquired character subsists in the one who acquires it. And sometimes another creates that character in him, and he is then characterized by the Divine Morals [الأخلاق الإلهية]. This is because the servant is commanded, and The Real does not command Himself. Thus, acquiring character is the compliance with Allah's command through Allah's strength and aid.

[It is a matter of proper conduct (Adab) for the characterized person to see himself as characterized and obligated]

It is a matter of proper conduct [الأدب] for the characterized person to see himself as characterized and obligated, even if The Real is his hearing and his sight. Has not The Real affirmed the servant's specific entity [عين عبده] through the pronoun in "his hearing" and "his sight"? Where can this servant go when the entity is present? His ultimate state is to be a form restricted within the primordial matter [هيولى] of Absolute Existence [الوجود المطلق]. He has no rank beyond this except non-existence [العدم], and non-existence does not accept form. Understand this. End of the Thirty-Third Part.

(Chapter on the person in a state of major ritual impurity [جنب] touching the Quranic manuscript [المصحف])

In the Name of Allah, the Most Compassionate, the Most Merciful. Scholars of the Sacred Law differed regarding the person in a state of major ritual impurity touching the Quranic manuscript. Some permitted the person in a state of major ritual impurity to touch the Quranic manuscript, while others forbade it.

(Connection) The consideration in this is:

The entire world [العالم] consists of the Words of Allah in Existence [الوجود]. Allah Almighty said concerning Jesus, peace be upon him: <<وكَلِمَتُهُ أَلْقاها إِلى‏ مَرْيَمَ>> (And His Word which He bestowed upon Mary). And He Almighty said: <<ما نَفِدَتْ كَلِماتُ الله>> (The Words of Allah would not be exhausted). And He Almighty said: <<إِلَيْهِ يَصْعَدُ الْكَلِمُ الطَّيِّبُ والْعَمَلُ الصَّالِحُ يَرْفَعُهُ>> (To Him ascends the good word, and the righteous deed elevates it). *Al-Kalim* is the plural of *Kalimah* (Word). And He Almighty says to a thing when He wills it, "Be!" [كُنْ], and that thing is clothed in formation [التكوين], and <<فَيَكُونُ>> (it is). Thus, Existence contains an unrolled scroll [رق منشور], and the World contains an inscribed book [كتاب مسطور]. Rather, it is a marked book [مرقوم], because it has two faces: a face that seeks the High and the Divine Names [الأسماء الإلهية], and a face that seeks the low, which is Nature [الطبيعة]. For this reason, we preferred the name *al-Marqūm* (marked) over *al-Mastūr* (inscribed). Every face of the marked book is inscribed. Concerning this, I say:

> The entity is wondrous in its transformation,
> In it, for the observer, is inscription and embellishment.
> Look at it, and you will see the marvels within it,
> For every face of the marked book is inscribed.
> Existence is a secret that bewilders its observer,
> The cosmos is marked, and the scroll is unrolled.

[The Fixed Entities (الأعيان) in Existence are an inscribed book]

The matter is as we said: an unrolled scroll, and the Fixed Entities [الأعيان] within it are an inscribed book. It is the Words of Allah that are never exhausted. His House is inhabited, His roof is raised, His sanctuary is forbidden (to others), and His command is heard. Where can this servant go, when he is one of the letters of this Quranic manuscript? <<أَ غَيْرَ الله تَدْعُونَ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صادِقِينَ بَلْ إِيَّاهُ تَدْعُونَ فَيَكْشِفُ ما تَدْعُونَ>> (Is it other than Allah you call upon, if you are truthful? Nay, but Him alone you call upon, and He removes that for which you call upon Him). Do you call upon the partner for its own sake? No, by Allah, except because in your belief it is a god. Thus, you called upon Allah, not that form, and for this reason your prayer was answered, while the form neither harms nor benefits.

[And your Lord decreed (قضى), meaning He judged, not commanded]

Look at His saying: <<قُلْ سَمُّوهُمْ>> (Say: Name them). If they name them by themselves, they are their very entities. They do not say concerning their object of worship that it is a stone, a tree, or a star that he carves with his hand and then worships. He did not worship its substance, and the form is his own making. If they name them with "the God" (Al-Ilah), you know that they worshipped the God. This is the realization of the matter in itself. The verse in the Quran has pointed to what we hold, by His Almighty saying: <<وقَضى‏ رَبُّكَ أَلَّا تَعْبُدُوا إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ>> (And your Lord decreed [قضى] that you worship none but Him). For us, this means He judged [حكم], whereas for those scholars of outward forms [علماء الرسوم] who lack knowledge of the Realities [الحقائق], it means He commanded [أمر]. And between the two meanings in realization, there is a vast difference.

[Worship Allah as if you see Him—this is a drawing near to those who worshipped Him]

The saying of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, teaching us: "Worship Allah as if you see Him." And in the Hadith of Gabriel with him, peace and blessings be upon him, when he asked him about *Ihsan* (Excellence) in the presence of a group of Companions, he said, peace and blessings be upon him: "It is that you worship Allah as if you see Him." So, he used the particle *ka-anna* (as if). You know that Imagination [الخيال] is the treasury of sensory perceptions, and The Real is not perceptible to us, and we only comprehend His Existence [وجوده]. Thus, *ka-anna* was used so that we might bring Him under the power of sight and attach Him, through imagination [الوهم], to sensory perceptions. This brought us closer to those who worshipped Him in what they carved.

[The honor of the particle of similitude, which is *ka-anna*]

Reflect upon what we have indicated, for the matter is only as established by the Lawgiver. He established something in one place that He denied in another. The knower among us is the one who establishes what The Real established in the place where The Real established it, and denies what The Real denied in the place where The Real denied it. There is nothing there but pure faith [الايمان الصرف]. So, take nothing from the authority of your intellect except acceptance. Look at how noble the particle of similitude, which is *ka-anna*, is.

> *Ka-anna* is our sovereign, so look for news of it,
> For it is news about her, along with the news.
> *Ka-anna* is a particle that holds sovereignty in the cosmos,
> If you know that knowledge lies in sight.
> It is the Imam in whom we are disposed,
> And no creature of mankind can resist it.

[The heart is a Quranic manuscript containing the Word of Allah]

There is no doubt that the People of Allah [أهل الله] have made the heart like the Quranic manuscript that contains the Word of Allah, just as the heart encompassed The Real, Glorious is His Majesty, when the heavens and the earth could not contain Him. Just as we were commanded to purify the heart [تنزيه القلب] from the defilement of the entry of others [الأغيار] into it, and we see that the Quranic manuscript contains the Word of Allah, which is His Attribute [صفته], and the Attribute does not separate from the Described. Whoever purifies the Attribute purifies the Described. And whoever observes the sign [الدليل] for a matter has observed the signified [المدلول] which is that matter. Thus, according to both schools of thought, the Quranic manuscript should be purified from being touched by a person in a state of major ritual impurity [جنب].

[The prohibition of traveling with the Quran to the land of the enemy]

We have been forbidden to travel with the Quran to the land of the enemy. The Quranic manuscript was called the Quran because of its manifestation therein. But the bearers of the Quran were not forbidden to travel to the land of the enemy, even though the Quran is preserved in their breasts just as it is in the manuscript, because of its inwardness [بطونه] within them. Do you not see that nothing prevented the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, from reciting the Quran except major ritual impurity [الجنابة]? This is because the Quran manifests during recitation through the letters that are uttered, which The Real informed us are His Almighty Word. Thus, He said to His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: <<فَأَجِرْهُ حَتَّى يَسْمَعَ كَلامَ الله>> (Grant him protection until he hears the Word of Allah). And the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, recited it to him.

[The person in a state of major ritual impurity (جنب) should not touch the Quranic manuscript nor recite it]

It is not proper for the person in a state of major ritual impurity [جنب]—who is estranged [الغريب] from what The Real deserves—to touch the Quranic manuscript. For distance based on realities [الحقائق] and limits [الحدود] never contains nearness. While physical distance may bring the traveler closer to the one whose proximity he seeks. Just as the Lord cannot be a servant, the servant cannot be a Lord, because he is a servant by virtue of his own self, just as the Lord is a Lord by virtue of His Essence [الذات]. Thus, the servant is not characterized by any of the Attributes of The Real in the sense that The Real is characterized by them, nor is The Real characterized by what is the reality of the servant. Therefore, the person in a state of major ritual impurity should never touch the Quranic manuscript based on this consideration, nor should he recite it in this state.

[The servant should manifest nothing but pure servitude]

The servant should manifest nothing but pure servitude [العبادة المحضة], for he is entirely in a state of major ritual impurity [جنب], so he should not touch the Quranic manuscript. If he acquires character, then it is the Hand of The Real that touches the Quranic manuscript, for He said concerning Himself regarding the servant He loves, that He is "his hand with which he strikes." Look at this excessive nearness and this union [الاتحاد]. Where does it stand in relation to the distance of the Realities [الحقائق]? By Allah, none knows Allah but Allah. So, do not tire yourself, O seeker of intellectual speculation [صاحب النظر]. Turn with The Real wherever He turns, and take from Him what He makes known to you of Himself. Do not use analogy [تقس], lest you become bankrupt—nay, rather, lest you become miserable. Know that the Hand of The Real is pure in its origin, sanctified, like the purity of water used in worship. Be alert to what I have made known to you in this section.

(Chapter on the recitation of the Quran by the person in a state of major ritual impurity)

[Scholarly opinions on the recitation of the Quran by the person in a state of major ritual impurity]

Scholars of the Sacred Law differed concerning this. Some forbade the recitation of the Quran by the person in a state of major ritual impurity, whether restricted or unrestricted, and some permitted it. As for the inheritor [الوارث] in my view, he does not recite the Quran while in a state of major ritual impurity, following the example of the one he inherits from: <<لَقَدْ كانَ لَكُمْ في رَسُولِ الله أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌ>> (Indeed, in the Messenger of Allah you have a good example). Nothing prevented him from reciting the Quran except major ritual impurity. However, the prevailing understanding for me, based on circumstantial evidence, is that he disliked mentioning Allah through recitation except in a state of complete purity, for he performed dry ablution [tayammum] to return a greeting and said, "I disliked mentioning Allah except in a state of purity," or he said, "in a state of purification." Some people permitted the person in a state of major ritual impurity to recite the Quran, whether restricted or unrestricted. I also hold the view of unrestricted permission, but I dislike it, following the example of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him.

(Connection) The consideration in this is:

The one who follows the actions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, forbids recitation of the Quran during major ritual impurity without restriction. We have informed you that major ritual impurity [الجنابة] is estrangement [الغربة], and estrangement is the departure of a person from his homeland where he was raised and born. Whoever is estranged from his homeland is forbidden from being characterized by the Divine Names [الأسماء الإلهية] during his estrangement. Allah Almighty said: <<ذُقْ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْكَرِيمُ>> (Taste! Indeed, you are the mighty, the noble)—as he claimed himself to be. For he has become estranged from his homeland, and he is a claimant.

[The Quran was only named Quran due to the reality of gathering (الجمعية) within it]

What I say concerning this matter for the People of Realization [أهل التحقيق] is that the Quran was only named Quran due to the reality of gathering [الجمعية] within it, for it gathers what The Real has informed about Himself and what He has informed about His creatures and servants, which He related from them. The person in a state of major ritual impurity, when he intends to recite, must either look and be present in the fact that The Real is translating for us, through His Word, what His servants said, or he looks at it from the perspective of the one being translated from. If he looks from the perspective of the one being translated from, he may recite. But in the first case, he should not recite until he purifies his inner self [باطنه]. The form of his inner purification is that The Real becomes his tongue with which he speaks, just as The Real was his hand in touching the Quranic manuscript. In that case, it is The Real who is reciting His Word, not the servant in a state of major ritual impurity.

[The Quran is originated (محدث) in terms of its coming, eternal (قديم) in terms of its descent]
